description: Verify that the backup schedule configuration page loads correctly with proper authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to the backup schedule configuration page to manage automated backup settings
expected_results: Display the backup schedule configuration page with header, schedule status, configuration form, and info box
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/backup-schedule
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check header with 'Backup Schedule Configuration' title
5. Verify 'Back to Backup' button is visible and functional

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the backup schedule configuration page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access the backup schedule management functionality
expected_results: Access should be denied and user redirected to appropriate error page
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/backup-schedule
3. Verify access is denied
4. Check redirect to login or unauthorized page
5. Ensure no schedule configuration is accessible

description: Verify the schedule status section displays current configuration accurately
scenario: Admin views the schedule status to understand current backup automation settings
expected_results: Display current configuration with status (enabled/disabled), frequency, retention period, and next backup information
procedure:
1. Navigate to backup schedule page as admin
2. Locate 'Schedule Status' section
3. Verify status shows 'Enabled' or 'Disabled' with appropriate colors
4. Check frequency displays correctly (daily/weekly/monthly)
5. Confirm retention period shows in days format

description: Verify the next backup section shows correct scheduling information
scenario: Admin checks when the next automatic backup is scheduled to occur
expected_results: Display next backup date and time or 'No automatic backup scheduled' message with appropriate icon
procedure:
1. Check 'Next Backup' section in schedule status
2. If auto backup enabled, verify date/time format (YYYY-MM-DD at HH:MM)
3. If disabled, verify 'No automatic backup scheduled' message
4. Confirm calendar icons display correctly
5. Verify blue styling for the info box

description: Verify the automatic backup enable/disable toggle functions correctly
scenario: Admin enables or disables automatic backup functionality using the toggle switch
expected_results: Toggle switch updates visual state and configuration when clicked
procedure:
1. Locate 'Automatic Backups' toggle in configuration section
2. Note current state (enabled/disabled)
3. Click the toggle switch
4. Verify visual state changes (slider position and colors)
5. Check toggle responds to keyboard navigation

description: Verify the backup frequency dropdown provides correct options and selection
scenario: Admin selects different backup frequency options to configure schedule timing
expected_results: Dropdown shows daily, weekly, monthly options with current selection highlighted
procedure:
1. Locate 'Backup Frequency' dropdown
2. Click dropdown to open options
3. Verify options: Daily (Recommended), Weekly, Monthly
4. Select different option and verify selection updates
5. Check 'Daily (Recommended)' shows recommendation text

description: Verify the backup time input allows proper time selection in 24-hour format
scenario: Admin sets specific time for automated backups to occur during low traffic hours
expected_results: Time input accepts valid 24-hour format and displays default recommendation
procedure:
1. Locate 'Backup Time (24-hour format)' input field
2. Verify default value is set to '02:00'
3. Change time to different value (e.g., '03:30')
4. Verify input accepts 24-hour format (HH:MM)
5. Check recommendation text mentions '2:00 AM (low traffic hours)'

description: Verify the backup retention period input allows valid day values with proper constraints
scenario: Admin configures how long backup files should be kept before automatic deletion
expected_results: Number input accepts values between 1-365 days with current default and explanatory text
procedure:
1. Locate 'Backup Retention Period' input field
2. Verify default value matches schedule_info.backup_retention
3. Test input with valid values (1, 30, 365)
4. Try invalid values (0, 366) and check constraints
5. Verify explanatory text about automatic deletion

description: Verify backup storage location radio buttons display with proper states and future options
scenario: Admin selects where backup files should be stored for automated backups
expected_results: Radio buttons show local storage (enabled) and cloud storage (disabled/coming soon)
procedure:
1. Locate 'Backup Storage Location' radio button group
2. Verify 'Local Server Storage' is selected and enabled
3. Check 'Cloud Storage (Coming Soon)' is disabled
4. Confirm disabled option has cursor-not-allowed styling
5. Verify only local option can be selected currently

description: Verify email notification checkboxes for backup success and failure alerts
scenario: Admin configures email notifications to be informed about backup operation outcomes
expected_results: Checkboxes for success and failure notifications are both checked by default and functional
procedure:
1. Locate 'Email Notifications' checkbox group
2. Verify 'Notify on successful backup' is checked by default
3. Check 'Notify on backup failure' is checked by default
4. Test unchecking and rechecking both options
5. Confirm checkboxes respond to clicks and keyboard navigation

description: Verify the save schedule settings button displays correctly and submits form
scenario: Admin saves backup schedule configuration after making changes to settings
expected_results: Save button with proper styling and icon submits form to update schedule settings
procedure:
1. Locate 'Save Schedule Settings' button
2. Verify button shows check-circle icon and blue styling
3. Make changes to any configuration option
4. Click save button to submit form
5. Verify form submission occurs (note: actual saving depends on backend implementation)

description: Verify the information box displays production deployment requirements clearly
scenario: Admin reads information about implementing automated backups in production environment
expected_results: Yellow info box explains production requirements for automated scheduling with Celery/cron
procedure:
1. Locate yellow info box at bottom of page
2. Verify info-circle icon and yellow styling
3. Check heading 'Production Deployment Note'
4. Read explanation about Celery/cron job requirements
5. Confirm message mentions current development setup limitations

description: Verify the back to backup button navigates correctly to main backup page
scenario: Admin returns to main backup management page from schedule configuration
expected_results: Back button navigates to system backup management page with proper URL routing
procedure:
1. Locate 'Back to Backup' button in header
2. Verify button shows left arrow icon and blue styling
3. Click button to navigate back
4. Confirm navigation to /admin/system-backup URL
5. Verify main backup page loads correctly

description: Verify form validation for schedule configuration inputs with invalid data
scenario: Admin enters invalid data in schedule form to test client-side validation
expected_results: Proper validation messages for invalid time formats, retention values, and required fields
procedure:
1. Enter invalid time format (e.g., '25:00', 'abc')
2. Set retention period to 0 or negative value
3. Try to submit form with invalid data
4. Verify browser validation messages appear
5. Check form prevents submission with invalid data

description: Verify the schedule configuration form includes CSRF protection token
scenario: Security check to ensure form submissions are protected against CSRF attacks
expected_results: Hidden CSRF token field is present in form with valid token value
procedure:
1. Inspect schedule configuration form HTML
2. Locate hidden input field with name='csrf_token'
3. Verify token value is present and not empty
4. Check token format matches expected CSRF token pattern
5. Confirm form includes proper CSRF protection

description: Verify the schedule configuration page displays correctly on different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses schedule configuration from various devices to ensure responsive design
expected_results: Responsive layout adapts to mobile, tablet, and desktop with proper element stacking and spacing
procedure:
1. View schedule page on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Test on tablet view (768px width)
3. Check mobile view (375px width)
4. Verify form elements remain usable on all sizes
5. Confirm proper spacing and alignment on different devices

description: Verify the schedule page displays correctly in both light and dark themes
scenario: Admin switches between light and dark modes to ensure proper theming support
expected_results: All elements display with appropriate colors and contrast in both light and dark themes
procedure:
1. View schedule page in light mode
2. Switch to dark mode (if theme toggle available)
3. Verify all text remains readable with proper contrast
4. Check form elements use appropriate dark theme colors
5. Confirm icons and buttons adapt to theme correctly

description: Verify all interactive elements support proper keyboard navigation and accessibility
scenario: Admin navigates through schedule configuration using only keyboard input
expected_results: All form elements, buttons, and interactive components are accessible via keyboard
procedure:
1. Use Tab key to navigate through all form elements
2. Test Space/Enter keys on buttons and checkboxes
3. Verify focus indicators are visible on all elements
4. Check dropdown can be opened and navigated with arrows
5. Confirm form can be completed using only keyboard

description: Verify that schedule configuration data persists correctly between page visits
scenario: Admin configures schedule settings, navigates away, then returns to verify persistence
expected_results: All configured schedule settings remain saved and display correctly on page reload
procedure:
1. Configure various schedule settings (frequency, time, retention)
2. Save configuration
3. Navigate to different admin page
4. Return to schedule configuration page
5. Verify all previously saved settings are displayed correctly

description: Verify schedule info object displays accurate current configuration values
scenario: Admin views schedule page to see current configuration reflected from backend data
expected_results: All schedule_info values display correctly including enabled status, frequency, and retention
procedure:
1. Check auto_backup_enabled status reflects correct boolean value
2. Verify backup_frequency shows correct option (daily/weekly/monthly)
3. Confirm backup_retention displays correct number of days
4. Check next_scheduled_backup shows proper date or null handling
5. Verify last_auto_backup handles null values gracefully

description: Verify ability to reset form to default values when needed
scenario: Admin makes changes to schedule configuration and wants to revert to defaults
expected_results: Form can be reset to original values without saving changes
procedure:
1. Note original configuration values
2. Make changes to multiple form fields
3. Use browser refresh or reset mechanism
4. Verify form returns to original values
5. Check no changes were saved permanently

description: Verify proper error handling when schedule configuration fails to save
scenario: Schedule configuration save operation encounters an error during processing
expected_results: Appropriate error messages display without exposing sensitive system information
procedure:
1. Simulate server error during save operation
2. Submit schedule configuration form
3. Verify error message appears to user
4. Check error doesn't expose internal system details
5. Confirm user can retry operation after error

description: Verify the schedule configuration page loads within acceptable time limits
scenario: Admin navigates to schedule page and measures loading performance
expected_results: Page loads completely within 3 seconds with all components rendered properly
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache and cookies
2. Navigate to /admin/backup-schedule
3. Measure page load time from request to complete render
4. Verify all CSS and JavaScript assets load properly
5. Check page is interactive within reasonable time

description: Verify schedule form properly validates and sanitizes all input data
scenario: Admin attempts to submit malicious or unexpected data in schedule form
expected_results: Form properly validates and sanitizes input to prevent security vulnerabilities
procedure:
1. Attempt to submit XSS payloads in text fields
2. Try SQL injection patterns in form inputs
3. Submit extremely large values for numeric fields
4. Test special characters and Unicode in text inputs
5. Verify all input is properly sanitized server-side

description: Verify all schedule page components integrate properly with consistent styling
scenario: Admin reviews complete schedule page for visual consistency and component integration
expected_results: All components use consistent styling, spacing, and color schemes throughout the page
procedure:
1. Check header component matches admin panel styling
2. Verify schedule status component uses consistent card design
3. Confirm configuration form follows established form patterns
4. Check info box styling matches other info boxes
5. Verify all components align properly in layout

description: Verify schedule page URL routing works correctly with proper admin authentication
scenario: Admin accesses schedule page through direct URL and navigation to ensure routing works
expected_results: URL /admin/backup-schedule routes correctly and maintains admin authentication state
procedure:
1. Navigate directly to /admin/backup-schedule URL
2. Verify page loads correctly without navigation errors
3. Check admin authentication is maintained
4. Test URL with and without trailing slash
5. Confirm proper redirect if not authenticated

description: Verify schedule configuration page works correctly across different web browsers
scenario: Admin accesses schedule page using various browsers to ensure cross-browser compatibility
expected_results: Page displays and functions correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers
procedure:
1. Test page in Google Chrome (latest version)
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check display and features in Safari (if available)
4. Test in Microsoft Edge browser
5. Confirm all interactive elements work in each browser

description: Verify schedule page properly handles admin session timeouts and renewals
scenario: Admin has extended session on schedule page to test session management
expected_results: Proper handling of session timeout with appropriate redirects and login prompts
procedure:
1. Log in as admin and navigate to schedule page
2. Leave page open for extended period
3. Attempt to save configuration after session timeout
4. Verify appropriate redirect to login page
5. Check session renewal maintains form data if possible

description: Verify all help text and documentation on schedule page is accurate and helpful
scenario: Admin reads all help text and instructions to understand schedule configuration
expected_results: All help text, descriptions, and documentation provide accurate and useful information
procedure:
1. Review description text for each configuration option
2. Check help text provides useful guidance (e.g., 'low traffic hours')
3. Verify time format instructions are clear
4. Confirm retention period explanation is accurate
5. Check production deployment note provides actionable information

description: Verify schedule configuration integrates properly with main backup management functionality
scenario: Admin configures schedule settings and verifies integration with main backup system
expected_results: Schedule configuration properly integrates with backup creation and management features
procedure:
1. Configure schedule settings and save
2. Navigate back to main backup page
3. Verify schedule button shows proper state
4. Check if schedule settings affect backup creation
5. Confirm integration between schedule and backup management
